item.title: Rumor: Switch 2 Image Potentially Leaked by Accessory Maker
item.description:
Summary

  • Third-party company Dbrand possibly leaked an image of the upcoming Nintendo Switch 2 console.
  • Dbrand's accessory case suggests new features for the Switch 2, including an extra button.

Third-party accessories manufacturer Dbrand might have leaked a look at the highly anticipated follow-up to the Nintendo Switch . The leaks come right as anticipation for a new generation of Switch hardware is hitting a peak.

With the Switch entering its eighth year of service as one of the most popular consoles in the world, fans are getting increasingly anxious about when Nintendo will reveal its plans for a hardware upgrade. Though Nintendo has yet to even officially name its next console, more information about what's next from the company appears to be coming from outside sources. The most recent Switch 2 rumors have been powered by images and info leaked by third-party contractors working with Nintendo, like accessory makers tooling up to design or produce items to go with the successor console.

One such accessory maker is Canada-based Dbrand, which launched a page promoting what it calls the "Switch 2 Killswitch" carrying case. The page features an image of the case with a game console inside. The naming of the accessory, combined with some notable differences between the hardware covered by the case and the actual Nintendo Switch hardware, suggests that Dbrand is indirectly showing fans and potential customers what the Switch 2 will actually look like. With excitement high for the Switch 2 potentially addressing issues with the current hardware, the promotion quickly gathered attention from onlookers and commentators. In comments to Insider Gaming, Dbrand CEO Adam Ijaz said that the hardware rendered inside the case matches the design for the Switch 2.

Switch 2 Hardware Images Potentially Leaked

Dbrand also put up images of the Switch 2 Killswitch case on its official Twitter account. The design of the case lines up with other rumors about changes to the Switch 2 design over the current Switch and Switch OLED. For example, the case includes indentations for an additional button on the right-side Joy-Con housing, distinct from the current "Home" button.

Though Dbrand didn't say exactly how it obtained the design for the Switch 2, its status as an accessory maker puts it in a position to know what the Switch 2 will look like. Such companies need early information about hardware designs to design and make their products in a timely manner. Dbrand is also known for bold moves that occasionally attract the ire of the major console makers. In 2021, Dbrand fell afoul of Sony, which forced it to stop selling black faceplates for the PlayStation 5. When officially branded black PS5 faceplates went on sale in 2022, Dbrand mocked Sony for not "figuring out the color black."

Dbrand isn't the only accessory manufacturer to potentially tip its hand about the Switch 2, whether by accident or intention. Just a few days ago, accessory maker Satisfye accidentally uploaded a trailer for a Switch 2 accessory, the Zengrip 2, revealing blurry images of the Switch 2 (or a close mockup).

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Update Adds Helpful New Features
item.description:
Summary

  • FF7 Remake 1.004 update adds Head Start Mode for boosted start.
  • New fast-forward feature allows players to speed through cinematics.
  • Rebirth for PC set to release in January to continue the FF7 story.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake has released its 1.004 update, and with it, two helpful new features that fans can use to make their playthroughs a bit easier and more convenient in both the standard campaign and the INTERmission DLC. The Final Fantasy 7 Remake update is out now for both PS5 and PC.

Final Fantasy 7 fans are pretty excited for the upcoming release of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth on PC. Square Enix finally revealed when Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will arrive on PC at The Game Awards, and gamers won't have to wait much longer to try out the next chapter of the story, as it will release in January.

In the meantime, Final Fantasy 7 Remake , the first of the FF7 remake trilogy, has released its new 1.004 update. This update adds two new features: Head Start Mode and fast-forwarding. Head Start Mode gives players a leg up from the get-go, allowing them to start a fresh game in either the main campaign or the DLC with significant bonuses. Players utilizing this mode can get started with their party members at level 45, fully leveled materia, good gear for every party member, items, and 50,000 gil to spend. For players who have tried the game before or are just looking to experience the story, this may be a great way of accomplishing that.

Additionally, Final Fantasy 7 Remake has added a feature that lets players fast-forward the game's many cinematic scenes. Players can nose choose between 1.5 or 2x speed, allowing them to zip through the cinematics with ease. This feature will be particularly useful for those who haven't yet played Final Fantasy 7 Remake and want to speed through it before Rebirth arrives on PC.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's update arrives at a good time, and may help to give Rebirth a boost. Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth didn't sell as well as Square Enix had hoped, so bringing it to PC gives the company an opportunity to engage the PC gaming market. As Steam has seen tremendous growth and new player milestones this year, there's a plentiful audience to potentially target. As the holidays approach, the original may also go on sale, potentially introducing new players to the trilogy as a whole.

Though Final Fantasy 7 Remake has featured difficulty options from the get-go, these new abilities should make the experience even more enjoyable for players.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake 1.004 Full Patch Notes

[Updates]

・"New Game - Head Start" is now available. When selecting "NEW GAME" on the title screen, you have the option to start the game with the character level and inventory already powered-up. * There is an option to choose a regular "NEW GAME" as well.

▼What will be powered-up

-All characters will start at level 45 *You will have SP (skill points) equivalent to the amount you would've obtained when getting to level 45.

-A number of materia at max level

-Each character will have gear available toward the middle to the end of the story.

-Each character will have accessories available toward the middle to the end of the story.

-A number of items useful to you adventure.

-50,000 gil in your posession

*You can choose this for both the main game as well as FF7R EPISODE INTERmission.

・"Fast-forward" during event scenes are now available. This will allow you to watch the scene without skipping over it, at 1.5 or 2.0 times speed.

item.title: The Witcher 4 Needs to Put Its Money Where Its Cinematic Trailer’s Mouth is
item.description:
This year's Game Awards were stacked with major announcements, and the first look at The Witcher 4 brought a jaw-dropping cinematic trailer to audiences. In this new chapter, Ciri takes on the protagonist role, continuing Geralt's legacy. Based on the announcement trailer, The Witcher 4 brings a more mature and skilled version of Ciri into the spotlight, promising a fascinating new story.

The eerie atmosphere of The Witcher 4 's first sneak peek makes it clear that CD Projekt Red has more harrowing monster encounters in store for players. While getting to see The Witcher 's Ciri in action against the spider-like beast in the trailer is thrilling, The Witcher 4 can hopefully deliver on the size of its monsters. The many monsters players have to face in The Witcher franchise can present some tough challenges . Still, The Witcher 4 's teased beasts are hopefully just as intimidating as they look in its cinematic announcement.

The Witcher 4's Monsters Need to Live Up to Expectations

CD Projekt Red Confirms the Name of the Monster Featured in the Trailer

In an interview with IGN, Witcher 4 game director Sebastian Kalemba confirmed the name of the monster that Ciri fights in the trailer. The creature is called Bauk, and according to Kalembda, it's a force to be reckoned with. In the interview, Kalemba states, "He has this ability to smell your fear, to be able to play with your traumas, to paralyze you." Based on this statement alone, the Bauk could prove to be one of The Witcher franchise's most terrifying monsters. That wasn't all the information Kalemba shared about the Bauk, though.

According to the interview, CD Projekt Red was heavily inspired by Cyberpunk 2077 's Phantom Liberty DLC when designing the Bauk. Citing Phantom Liberty's Chimera tank boss, Kalemba claims Bauk is the result of what developers learned from working on such large enemy types. "The Chimera was a very, very good lesson on our path when it comes to designing big creatures," he states.

There is no official release date or time frame for The Witcher 4 at this time.

This statement is incredibly promising, as it leads one to believe that at least some of the monsters featured in The Witcher 4 will be the biggest the franchise has seen yet. The Bauk was massive, and as more information comes out about the action RPG, it will be fascinating to see if there are monsters that are even more intimidating. While Ciri serves as this new era's protagonist, Geralt will still be in The Witcher 's picture, just not as much.

The Official Wait For The Witcher's New Era Begins

Although theories and speculation predicted a Ciri-led Witcher game, nothing had been made official until The Game Awards. CD Projekt Red's secrecy surrounding the project has finally come to an end, but there is still a long road ahead, unfortunately. With no release target announced, The Witcher 4 could still be a long time away. On the bright side, though, CD Projekt Red's past with Cyberpunk 2077 has likely taught the studio to not announce games too early, which could be a promising indication of how far along The Witcher 4 is.

Only time will tell what The Witcher 4 has in store, but the game has already made a strong impression with its heart-pounding teaser. As time passes, more Witcher 4 news will hopefully arrive sooner rather than later with even more monster sneak peeks and possible hints at what gameplay will ultimately look like.

item.title: Delta Force - Tidal Surge Bundle Trailer
item.description: Delta Force reveals its Tidal Surge Bundle, which lets players deck out a variety of existing weapons in a sleek blue-and-yellow color scheme. The Tidal Surge Bundle will be available in Delta Force for a limited time starting on December 13, 2024.

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection Confirms Important Quality-Of-Life Features and Online Play
item.description:
Summary

  • Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection includes online multiplayer and quality-of-life features like rewinding gameplay states.
  • The collection features classic titles never localized in the West, remastered for modern platforms.
  • Players can customize gameplay, unlock hidden content, and remove restrictions for a more enjoyable experience.

Konami and Digital Eclipse confirmed a number of features for the upcoming Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection , including quality-of-life features like rewinding gameplay states, removing deck limits, and online multiplayer. The Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection package features a number of classic titles remastered for modern platforms. These include games that were never localized in the West and have been Japan-only releases for the longest time.

First revealed in February 2024 for the franchise's 25th anniversary, the Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection digs deep into its back catalog, with fourteen games collected from across its long history that were previously released on the Game Boy, Game Boy Color, and Game Boy Advance systems. This package of retro video games includes titles from the series' past that use a different ruleset that was established before the physical card game's traditions were set. With the Early Days Collection set for a February 2025 release on both Nintendo Switch and PC via Steam, Konami and Digital Eclipse have revealed some new features exclusive to this remastered collection, including some important quality-of-life features that will make certain titles a much easier time.

On the official Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection Steam page, one of the first things confirmed for the remastered releases is online play. Players can challenge each other in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters 4: Battle of Great Duelists at launch, with select titles in the collection getting an online play patch post-launch as well. Certain Yu-Gi-Oh titles like Stairway to the Destined Duel and Destiny Board Traveler did support multiplayer with the Game Boy's link cable, so it's entirely possible that these titles will get multiplayer after launch.

Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection's Features:

  • Online Multiplayer: Challenge Duelists from around the world with online play in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters 4: Battle of Great Duelists! Select titles will also be updated to support online play after release.
  • Customizable Gameplay: Unlock hidden characters and cards, the option to remove Deck Capacity, Duelist Level, and cards from the Forbidden & Limited List, customize your button mapping, and much more.
  • Rewind and Fast-Forward: Turn back the clock with the Rewind function or fast-forward to watch your strategy unfold at mach speeds.
  • Save Anywhere: Pick up and Duel right where you left off with the option to save at any time.
  • Digital Gallery: Explore preserved box art and manuals from each title in the Digital Gallery.

Also listed in the Steam description is the game's variety of quality-of-life features, including the ability to save anywhere and the rewind and fast-forward functions. The most important QoL feature listed, however, is the ability to customize the gameplay. This includes the ability to unlock certain characters and cards straight away, along with the ability to remove Deck Capacity, Duelist Level, and cards from the Forbidden and Limited list. Many of these features can make certain classic Yu-Gi-Oh games, such as the highly contentious Reshef of Destruction , much easier, as it imposed a lot of artificial difficulty. Reshef of Destruction in particular was criticized for only being able to save the game in one spot, along with the restrictions that stemmed from the Deck Capacity and Duelist Level mechanics.

The ability to turn off some of these features is entirely optional, so hardcore nostalgia-driven fans can also play these classic retro Yu-Gi-Oh games in their original form as well. The Early Days Collection will also feature a digital gallery that preserves all the box art and manuals from each title, too. All told, Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection looks to be a complete retro package with enough modern features for fans to enjoy.
